snippet: The Marriott Corporation agreed to sell 120 coffee shops it owns in California to a privately held restaurant company for $65 million. The restaurants, Bob's Big Boy and Allie's, are being sold to the Restaurant Enterprises Group of Irvine, Calif....
lead_paragraph: The Marriott Corporation agreed to sell 120 coffee shops it owns in California to a privately held restaurant company for $65 million. The restaurants, Bob's Big Boy and Allie's, are being sold to the Restaurant Enterprises Group of Irvine, Calif., which operates 514 restaurants in 26 states.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times
